Are you passionate about machine learning and data science, and eager to gain hands-on experience in a collaborative and innovative environment this summer? Join our team as a Data Science Intern to help shape the future of intelligent analytics by transforming complex data into meaningful insights through advanced analysis and modeling that drive smarter, data-driven decisions!About the BusinessLexisNexis Risk Solutions is the essential partner in the assessment of risk. Within our Insurance vertical, we provide customers with solutions and decision tools that combine public and industry-specific content with advanced technology and analytics to assist them in evaluating and predicting risk and enhancing operational efficiency. Our insurance risk solutions help drive better data-driven decisions across the insurance policy lifecycle all while reducing risk. You can learn more about LexisNexis Risk at the link below. https://risk.lexisnexis.com/insuranceAbout our Team Join a dynamic team at the forefront of life insurance innovation! The Life Analytics group is dedicated to transforming how carriers understand and manage risk through advanced data science and statistical modeling. Our mission is to deliver actionable insights that empower smarter decisions and drive industry progress. As part of a collaborative, forward-thinking culture, you’ll contribute to projects that blend cutting-edge analytics with real-world impact—helping shape solutions that matter.About the Role As a Data Science Intern on the Life Analytics Team, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that help improve how health and life data are understood and used. You’ll work with both structured and unstructured Electronic Health Record (EHR) data to create clear, reliable datasets that support research and analytics. This role offers hands-on experience, opportunities to grow your technical skills, and the chance to collaborate with a supportive, mission-driven team.Location: On-site in Alpharetta, GA. Relocation assistance is not provided.  Program Dates: May 18 – July 24, 2026 Eligibility: Undergraduate students expected to graduate by May 2027. ResponsibilitiesPrepare clean, analytics‑ready datasets through data extraction, standardization, and normalization.Explore EHR data to identify trends and key factors related to health and mortality outcomes.Support translation of clinical data into fields relevant to insurance and risk assessment.Assist in developing insights that guide life analytics and risk modeling.RequirementsBe currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in data science, computer science, actuarial science, or a related field of study with a graduation date of May 2027. Demonstrate proficiency in Python for data analysis and modeling.Display familiarity with statistical or machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, decision trees, random forests). Interest in NLP or LLMs is helpful, but not required.Possess knowledge or curiosity about healthcare data or life/mortality studies is a plusExhibit solid analytical and problem-solving skills, with an openness to learning new tools and methods.Be able to collaborate effectively in a team of developers and scientists.   Possess effective written and verbal communication skills to document findings and share ideas clearly.  Learn more about the LexisNexis Risk team and how we work here.  Salary $20/hour   #earlycareer 

This position is not eligible for benefits.
